item.description: <p>T﻿here are safety fears that regulators fear could lead to potentially deadly fires on the road.</p>

item.title: Australia's deadliest industries revealed in new Safe Work Australia report
item.description: <p>O﻿verall, workplace safety is improving in Australia, but some industries pose more danger than others.</p>

item.title: Renewed call for information after 'inconsistencies' found during investigation into toddler's death
item.description: <p>Detectives are renewing their calls for information about the suspicious death of a Queensland toddler in﻿ 2022 after discovering &quot;inconsistencies&quot; in information they were initially given.</p>

item.title: Judge slams man for fatally stabbing soon-to-be father after 'minor disagreement'
item.description: <p>T﻿he killer was jailed for two decades over the 2022 incident.</p>

item.title: Aussies' access to cash declines as number of ATMs dwindles
item.description: <p>The number of ATMs run by Australian banks has almost halved over the past five years, with hundreds dropping out of rotation in the last year alone.</p>

item.title: 'Arc de Trump': Plans for Presidential arch unveiled
item.description: <p>US President Donald Trump wants to leave his mark on the nation&#x27;s capital by building a Paris-style arch just west of the Lincoln Memorial.</p>

item.title: Five hospitalised after 'prohibited substance' in parcel sparks chemical leak at two Australia Post locations
item.description: <p>Five people have been taken to hospital after a parcel containing a prohibited substance is believed to have caused a chemical leak at two Australia Post locations in Queensland.</p>

item.title: Record-breaking October temperatures expected in multiple states
item.description: <p>A﻿ large buildup of heat in Western Australia is spreading across the country.</p>

item.title: Road rage victim's ashes in court as family speaks ahead of killer's sentencing
item.description: <p>Rhyce Harding&#x27;s sister was hard at work when a radio report of a fatal road rage incident caught her attention.</p>

item.title: Woman stabbed in shocking daytime attack praises bystanders who rushed to her aid
item.description: <p>The woman who was stabbed in the chest on her way to work has praised the courage of the Melburnians who rushed to her aid.</p>

item.title: 'Expected to be dead': Missing camper tells of miracle rescue after nine-day ordeal
item.description: <p>The 61-year-old diabetic man said he never thought he&#x27;d be rescued.</p>

item.title: Rats caught crawling over inner-city pub grill in disturbing video
item.description: <p>Disturbing video footage has emerged of two large rats eating off the stove in the kitchen of an Adelaide pub.</p>

item.title: Woman arrested after man stabbed in 'targeted attack' at train station
item.description: <p>T﻿he man was found with life-threatening injuries police say were consistent with a stabbing.</p>

item.title: Search for missing boy comes to an end with no new information found
item.description: <p>A renewed search for four-year-old Gus Lamont has come to an end, with police and troops not finding any trace of the South Australian boy.</p>

item.title: Man and woman arrested after four alleged attempted carjackings in Bunnings car park
item.description: <p>A man who allegedly tried to carjack four different shoppers during a terrifying rampage in a Victorian Bunnings car park has been arrested in a dramatic police swoop.</p>

item.title: Thunderstorms dodge Sydney amid warnings across NSW
item.description: <p>By 8.30pm, the warning for Sydney, Newcastle and Wollongong had been cancelled although other threats remained across the state.</p>

item.title: Barnaby Joyce reportedly in 'advance talks' to defect to Pauline Hanson's One Nation
item.description: <p>Barnaby Joyce is reportedly considering defecting from the Nationals to join Pauline Hanson&#x27;s One Nation.</p>

item.title: Defence lawyers question historical rape DNA evidence
item.description: <p>Pieces of evidence, some collected in the 1980s and others retrieved by police in recent years, will be used to prove a cold case rape from four decades ago, a court has been told.</p>

item.title: Australians think Trump is bad news, but aren't ready to turn their backs on the US yet
item.description: <p>Far more Australians think Donald Trump&#x27;s second term as US president is bad news than those who think it&#x27;s positive, but they aren&#x27;t ready to call for a rethink of the relationship with our most important ally.</p>

item.title: The world is heading to add 57 superhot days a year, but study indicates it could have been worse
item.description: <p>Earth would be heading to an additional 114 days a year of those deadly extra hot days without current emissions targets in Paris agreement.</p>

item.title: Bolton pleads not guilty in Justice Department case accusing him of sharing government secrets
item.description: <p>John Bolton pleaded not guilty to charges accusing the former President Donald Trump national security adviser turned critic of emailing classified information to family members and keeping top secret documents at his Maryland home.</p>

item.title: Prince Andrew announces he's given up his Duke of York title and honours
item.description: <p>The move comes ahead of the posthumous release of Virginia Giuffre&#x27;s memoir, which is speculated to include more accusations against the royal, all of which he denies.</p>

item.title: Teen clocked speeding at over 150km/h in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: <p>T﻿he p-plater&#x27;s license was suspended on the spot, and the car was impounded for 30 days.</p>

item.title: Trump in f-bomb blast as tensions rise between US and Venezuela
item.description: <p>US President Donald Trump said that Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro does not want to &quot;f*** around&quot; with the United States, amid escalating tensions between Washington and Caracas.</p>

item.title: Baek Se-hee, author of bestselling memoir 'I Want To Die But I Want To Eat Tteokbokki,' dead at 35
item.description: <p>South Korean author Baek Se-hee, who wrote the bestselling memoir &quot;I Want to Die but I Want to Eat Tteokbokki,&quot; has died at age 35, the Korean Organ Donation Agency announced on Thursday.</p>

item.title: World risking systems collapse: 'We are on the verge of a change bigger than the industrial revolution'
item.description: <p>The world&#x27;s alarm bells are ringing loudly. What follows is a list of really good reasons to despair – and an excellent argument for why you absolutely should not.</p>

item.title: Laine died of complications from the measles. Anti-vaxxers turned up at the 12-year-old's funeral
item.description: <p>Mother Cecily Johnson knows anti-vaxxers don&#x27;t like her daughter&#x27;s story, but she keeps telling it anyway.</p>

item.title: Trump says he has commuted sentence of disgraced former politician
item.description: <p>President Donald Trump said on social media that he has commuted the sentence of disgraced former Republican George Santos, who had been serving a seven-year term for the fraud charges that got him ousted from Congress.</p>

item.title: The $10m plan to crack down on bullying across Aussie schools
item.description: <p>Over 1700 submissions recommended that schools should respond within two school days of receiving a bullying complaint.</p>

item.title: 'She's still very scared when she's in public': Family of Melbourne stabbing victim speak out
item.description: <p>T﻿he family say despite her strong recovery, she remains fearful of leaving her own home alone.</p>

item.title: Areas of NSW and Queensland braced for thunderstorms as wild weather continues
item.description: <p>T﻿he harsh weather conditions could bring damaging winds and hail.</p>

item.title: Prince Andrew: How the British royal was brought down by scandal
item.description: <p>Once widely reputed to be Queen Elizabeth&#x27;s favourite son and feted as a dashing young military officer, Britain&#x27;s Prince Andrew will now always be seen in the public eye as the royal who was accused of sexually abusing a teenage girl.</p>

item.title: 'Poor choice of words': Queensland Premier walks back stabbing remark
item.description: <p>Queensland Premier David Crisafulli has been forced to walk back a comment making light of stabbings in Melbourne, a day after footage emerged of a woman being randomly attacked in broad daylight. </p>

item.title: 'What's up, Bluesky?': White House joins Elon Musk's rival social media platform and immediately begins trolli
item.description: <p>The White House joined Bluesky, the social media platform that disgruntled users began flocking after billionaire Elon Musk took over Twitter.</p>

item.title: Pauline Hanson invites Barnaby Joyce to join One Nation after his relationship breakdown with the Nationals
item.description: <p>It comes after the maverick MP confirmed he will leave the Nationals after what he said was an &quot;irreparable breakdown&quot; in the relationship. ﻿</p>

item.title: Fears multiple takeaway orders contaminated after cluster of people sick with rat poisoning
item.description: <p>There are fears that multiple takeaway orders in south-east Queensland have been contaminated with rat poison after five people showed up sick at different hospitals.</p>

item.title: 'Unnecessary stress for students': HSC hoax slammed as 'rescheduling of exam' notice goes viral
item.description: <p>A viral photo of the notice that English 2 students are required to re-sit their final exam﻿ has been identified as false, with the education board slamming the scam as &quot;unnecessary stress for students&quot;.</p>

item.title: Suspicious fires take hold of three unoccupied homes across Melbourne
item.description: <p>Emergency services were called to Craigieburn, Glen Waverley and Noble Park as homes went up in flames before 5am today, sparking an investigation of the suspicious blazes.</p>

item.title: Sporting legends unite in support of Danny Green's Fight the Coward Punch campaign
item.description: <p>Members of Australia&#x27;s sporting elite came together in support of Danny Green&#x27;s coward punch awareness campaign.</p>
